interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: The Barbie Diaries
Review Date: 2013/03/04
Store: Kelly Sheridan  (Actor),     Sarah Edmondson  (Actor),     Eric Fogel  (Director),     Kallen Kagen  (Director)    &                   1                  more   Rated:    Unrated    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Lionsgate Home Entertainment, All Lionsgate Titles
Product Description: ['It\x92s a new school year and Barbie is hoping this year will be a little less ordinary. She loves hanging out with her best friends, playing with them in a band, working at the school TV station, and also has a crush on a boy. With a special diary and charm bracelet suddenly Barbie finds the courage to truly be herself, and exciting things start happening! Find out how fresh, fun, and exciting life can be in The Barbie Diaries!']
Average Rating: 4.4
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Kids & Family, Animation', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Closed-captioned, Animated, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Kallen Kagen, Sarah Edmondson, Venus Terzo, Anna Cummer, Ashleigh Ball, Michael Daingerfield, Andrew Francis, Maryke Hendrikse, Heather Doerksen, Kelly Sheridan, Matt Hill, Chiara Zanni, Eric Fogel, Joseph MayKallen Kagen, Sarah Edmondson, Venus Terzo, Anna Cummer, Ashleigh Ball, Michael Daingerfield, Andrew Francis, Maryke Hendrikse, Heather Doerksen, Kelly Sheridan, Matt Hill, Chiara Zanni, Eric Fogel, Joseph May  See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), Unqualified', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 10 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.66:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5 x 0.5 inches; 3.2 Ounces', 'Director': 'Eric Fogel, Kallen Kagen', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Closed-captioned, Animated, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 10 minutes', 'Release date': 'May 9, 2006', 'Actors': 'Kelly Sheridan, Sarah Edmondson, Venus Terzo, Chiara Zanni, Matt Hill', 'Studio': 'Lions Gate', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: A little mature for my seven year old, there was a lot of boy talk... I prefer the barbie movies that are more of an empowering theme.
Review Title: Cute movie.
Rating: 3.0

profile:
**User Summary:**

The user has a clear affinity for animated movies, particularly those targeting kids and families. They appreciate content that promotes empowerment and positive themes, as evidenced by their preference for Barbie movies that focus on strong, uplifting messages rather than romantic subplots. The user expressed concern that the recent movie they purchased was somewhat mature for their child, indicating a desire to ensure age-appropriate content. 

Additionally, the user seems to enjoy engaging narratives which foster friendship and personal growth, though they are cautious about excessive "boy talk" in films for younger audiences. The average rating of 3.0 reflects a moderate satisfaction, suggesting that while they may have enjoyed the animation and entertainment value, the overall theme did not meet their expectations for empowerment. 

In summary, this user gravitates towards family-friendly films with strong, positive messages, prioritizing content that empowers young viewers over more romantic or mature themes.
